characters: LOOKING UP AT THE APPROACHING COPTER
A WEAK PATCH IN THE RUBBER
THE STERN OF THE POLICE BOAT

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Dramatically lit by sunlight filtering down from the surf A dim shape, massive, threatening, swims towards us from distance. Then it divides -- what was one is two, and the shape becomes reality; two divers in Scuba gear swimming  side by side. They are wearing minimal rubber, considerin the cool New England waters: "Farmer John" wetsuits with off legs, assorted sport-diving paraphernalia, including expensive camera with a flash attachment. One motions "Down there," the other signals "OK, I see it and they dive deeper, into darker waters, where the shaft of sunlight pour into the depths, broken up by seaweed an floating vegetation into cathedral-like columns of  illumination.

dialogues.speaker: SEA BOTTOM
dialogues.text: The wreck of the working fisherman's boat "ORCA," formerl under the command of the late Captain Quint, deceased the four years. Buried in the sand near it, still connected by rusting st of cable, the mangled remains of a shark cage, glimmering with stainless steel highlights. A fitful flash of yellow from under a mossy beard -- a battered barrel, similarly  tangled. The divers, Bert and Ernie, appear. They're fascinated by the find, and Bert, with the camera, snaps a few flash sh The rapid sequence of flashes signals the presence of a m drive camera.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Distant flashes, obscured by vegetation in the foreground

dialogues.speaker: SEA BOTTOM, THE ORCA
dialogues.text: Ernie is exploring the abandoned cabin; doors open and sh moved by invisible currents stirred by his passage. An occasional "Flash!" lights up the bottom as Bert conti snapping away souvenir shots of this local landmark.

dialogues.speaker: BERT'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Ernie floats up out of a hatch, sees the camera, and stri a pose, clowning for the photographer's benefit. A big ha f.g., motions him up into clear water for a formal portra He obliges. Now he floats in front of us, gently paddling his flippers to maintain vertical stability. One flash. Another. Then a large, dim movement in the b.g. Something's out there, moving towards us. Flash. It's bigger, bearing down like a train in a tunnel Flash! It's on us. Flash! Teeth? Blood? Flash! Blackness, Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera floats gently down and settles in the sand. A  dark red mist eddies by. A last weak flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! An expensive cabin cruiser, the "Diver Working" fl fluttering limply in the breeze, is riding alone at ancho Flash! A distant lighthouse beacon winks at us. The boat  rocks in the ceaseless swell. On the stern, "Elizabeth T. - Newport, R.I." A long way f home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue-and-white police jeep is bouncing over the sand. A figure in civilian clothes driving alone on some urgent  mission. It's Martin Brody, Chief of Police on Amity. The jeep slows to a stop, and he takes a flight of stairs leading to a concrete patio two at a time. A classical tr solo is playing in the background. Brody charges through door, then abruptly slows and starts moving warily throug hotel interior: The Holidome, a three-story extravaganza a motel, where some sort of formal ceremony is already in progress. A banner announces: "Grand Opening Ball -- Amit Scholarship Fund Benefit." Brody crosses under a High Sch band, arranged dance-band style on a balcony; the trumpet player, Polo, is finishing his solo, the assembled crowd  applauds politely. Brody is taking his place with some  dignitaries on the dais, as the presiding authority, Amit Mayor Larry Vaughn, begins speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Paul Lohman, for that  eloquent solo. Now, for that point  in the ceremonies where we formally  dedicate this magnificent resort- hotel complex, a worthwhile addition  to the recreational paradise we call  Amity.

dialogues.speaker: THE DAIS
dialogues.text: Seated on folding chairs, wearing their good suits, sever of Amity's Selectmen, Real Estate Developer Len Peterson, and Ellen Brody, very chic. Brody slips into the vacant c next to her. The following is conducted in urgent whisper sotto voce, while Vaughn drones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. Don't you know this  is a big deal? BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't help it.  Hendricks over there... (he indicates his  deputy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...still has the keys  to the jeep in his  pocket, and I couldn't  find the spares. ELLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific. Act as if  you've been here all  along. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'm I supposed to do  that? ELLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody settles into polite attentiveness, acknowledging a  wave from Hendricks, a politely bland young town cop in h idea of civilian finery. Hendricks is fussing with the ba on an attractive young lady in a bathing suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And now, Tina Wilcox, this year's  Miss Amity, will cut the ribbon that  officially opens this luxurious new  hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina (the girl in the bathing suit) escapes Hendricks'  attentions, and teeters on high heels towards the ribbon, while Phil Fogarty, the local photographer, snaps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina was selected from more than 20  of this island's lovely young ladies in the Miss Amity competition  held every spring, and she'll  represent Amity Island in the Miss  Massachusetts Competition in Worcester  next month. When she cuts this ribbon,  she will be opening our island to  growth, to development, to planned  expansion with full employment for  our thriving community.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAND
dialogues.text: Paul Lohman ("Polo" to his friends) is exchanging whisper with Lucy, a flute player nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she's such hot stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are we going out? You and me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going with Patrick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods, Polo shrugs, and turns to Jane, a girl nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jane -- you want to dance as  soon as we get out of these monkey  suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods happily, they whisper together, while we:

dialogues.speaker: DAIS
dialogues.text: Martin and Ellen have been joined by their youngest son,  Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Michael won't talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) Shouldn't he be at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Silvera couldn't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This money tree, you may have noticed,  is made entirely of twenty-dollar  bills, donated by Len Peterson, the  builder of Amity Shores Condominiums,  as a gesture of goodwill towards the  community. $500 as a special gift to  the Amity township scholarship fund...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause from the crowd, Len takes a bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting) Go ahead, Tina.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: as she reaches out with the scissors. Something catches h eye, and she winks at her boyfriend, Ed Marchand, smirkin in the crowd. He winks back, and makes "Cut it" motions w his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: THE CEREMONY
dialogues.text: Tina cuts the ribbon, and Tom Andrews, a local diver, pus a decorated float out into the pool; sparklers sputter,  balloons drop from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to Tom Andrews, of Amity Aqua- Sports, for contributing the special  decorations. And now, the Amity High  School band. Refreshments on the  patio, everyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band swings into "Downtown," and the crowd gets up to dance, to eat, and to break into small groups to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is dragging Brody over to where Len Peterson and La Vaughn, the mayor, are in conversation. They pass vignett Tina and Ed, Tom Andrews and Jane, Marge, other interesti Amity townspeople.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Peterson and  Vaughn) Do I have to talk to those two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boss and your boss. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello. It went well, I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very impressive ceremony. Good speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you. You know my  son, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beckons over their heads to Larry Vaughn, Jr., a young man uncomfortable in his correct tie and blazer. They exc perfunctory greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speech was right on the money. (to Ellen) Be a love and make sure the bar's  open, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around her, a little too familiarly for  Brody's liking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brody) Fantastic lady. Don't know what I'd  do without her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Y'know, Brody -- for the first time  in years it's worth putting money  into this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us thank you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch Sean for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she hands Sean off to Brody, leaving him with an over active 10 year old, while she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go swimming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Find your brother, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean nods and runs off, happy to have a mission.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL BRODY
dialogues.text: He is talking to Brooke Peters, a mop-maned teen-ager wit pleasant face. Timmy Weldon, a grade behind, lurks nearby. A plumpish, c haired buddy, Andy Nicholas, is enjoying a cup of punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is your cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen. She's a senior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy about blind dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay, if they got little  white canes and tin cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell. (to Mike) Did your mom put all this together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's her job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she responsible for the punch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin will be here tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean finds them, and bursts into their group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, Michael, Dad said to find  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mikey, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs at Mike's sleeve; Mike allows himself to be dragg off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Brooke are left standing together, Tim moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brooke) Want to dance? (she shakes her head  "no") Okay. Later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her shrug, as she turns to Andy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's later; night has fallen, the band is playing its ver of "When I Fall in Love." Many teen-agers are dancing out the patio, some adults are dancing inside, the buffet is  ravaged, Timmy is watching Brooke, who's dancing with Pol Douglas Fetterman ("Doug") joins him, after asking Marge a dance and striking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a dance yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina Wilcox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. She's Ed's girl friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't hurt to ask. Sometimes the  most beautiful girls are the  loneliest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a crock of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Burnside, a tall pal of Larry Vaughn Jr.'s, turns up their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same tired old faces. You see Vaughn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Vaughn Junior? (Doug shrugs) If you see him, tell him I got a six- pack, a blanket, and the Brebner  twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits, on the prowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None at all. (pause) I wonder what the Brebner twins are  doing tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take a little time out from  your busy schedule to dance with the  old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're playing our song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sure enough, they are -- the band has turned to a Fif slow-dance standard: "I Wish You Love." Peterson approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have this dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm all booked up... (taking Ellen) Come, m'dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slowly fox trot out onto the terrace. Both of them  nodding greetings to townspeople and kids -- everyone kno the chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember 1959, the Jersey shore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how. I thought you wouldn't  respect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music and the summer moon are working their magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- what are you doing later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fooling around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dips with her; they look up and notice Sean, sound asl on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the kid home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the sleepy Sean and hoists him with a grunt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the kid) You're getting a little big for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean murmurs sleepily and hugs his dad. Mike, dancing wit Marge, waves good-bye. The Brodys start to leave, passing bucket with a bottle of champagne still in it. They excha a look, nod agreement, and Brody boosts the bottle, sneak it out of the building while Ellen giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody and Ellen are snuggling under the covers while earl morning light streams under the blinds. It's The Morning  After, and the clothes from the night before are scattere all over the room. Brody rolls against Ellen, spoon-fashi morning-horny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMmmmorning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to move a little, then turn face to face. Outs their door, the sounds of little feet; Sean padding  downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bodies move under the blankets. There's a crash fro the kitchen. They stop for a beat. As they resume, little feet return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The milk fell out of the 'frigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Put a towel down. And shh -- daddy's  sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His feet paddle off. Brody and Ellen start to slide toget passion resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bigger feet go downstairs; Michael's up. The Brodys kiss, trying to ignore the sounds of spirited discussion betwee brothers over who's responsible for spilled milk. Then th sound of a car pulling into the driveway, and a horn beep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Silvera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Silvera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to kiss again, there's a door slam downstairs, a talk between the boys and Mrs. Silvera. The Brodys look a each other and break up laughing at the morning, and  themselves.

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: As Ellen and Brody, with the practice of 18 years of marr swing back-to-back, and put their feet on the floor, each their side of the bed, still chuckling, up for the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the office.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AMITY STREET DAY
dialogues.text: The police jeep is driving through the picturesque street Brody behind the wheel, Ellen and Sean passengers. It slo near the foot of the street, dockside, where a real estat office marked "Amity Shores Development, Leonard Peterson Pres." sits. Peterson's big Cadillac is parked illegally the curb. It has the Amity Shores logo on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's daddy doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writing a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is out of the car, his pad in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! That's my boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peterson, in shirt-sleeves and a tie, hustles out of the  office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, it's written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck of a way to treat a taxpayer. (to Ellen) Don't you have any pull with the  chief, here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the ticket) Better get a sales kit together for  after lunch. I'm taking some prospects  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen kisses Brody, and starts in for her day's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brody) Can't we fix it up to get this made  into a green zone or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Len, pay the two dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peterson shrugs and goes inside his office. Brody's atten is drawn by some noise by the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks and an old codger, Red, are working on Amity's  newest bit of police equipment; a blue power launch for  patrolling local waters. The boat is Hendricks' personal  pride and joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Red) Tie it off on your left. Your other  left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Red complies, Hendricks spots his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking onto the  dock, Sean tagging  along) Aren't you off-duty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till noon. This is on my own time. (to Sean) Hi, Shorty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not short. I'm eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hoot from a passing boat horn. Sean waves happi

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: It has slowed to a halt in front of the police berth; it' scruffy working fisherman, back from the banks with a ful load. The Skipper hails Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a gold-plater drifting in  the main channel. Big cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereabouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the Point. No running lights,  just a diver's flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Brody) Want me to run out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your own time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then check it out. I'll be in the  office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks nods, and starts the engine importantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cast off your bow line. And your  stern line. Spring line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Red grumbles, Brody and Sean are walking up to the  street. Michael and some teen-agers are headed down to the dock.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AND THE KIDS
dialogues.text: It's Mike, Polo, Patrick, Lucy, Brooke, Ed and Tina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No place special. Just hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your kid brother, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets into his jeep, leaving Sean with the teen-agers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Mr. Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others ad lib appropriate greetings/good-byes, as Bro drives off in his jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids busy themselves with their boats while Sean hove around Mike, who's not happy at baby-sitting his kid brot POLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone want to sail to  the lighthouse? PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machs nix to me. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone got a spare  mooring line? Mine's  shot. TINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina's in her boat, "Tina's Joy," a neat sloop. Mike is g over his "Green Machine," a sleek catamaran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going out right away, are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go out with you. You need  a crew, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Sean can protest further, Mike spots his crew: And Nicholas, a round-faced, frizzy-haired pal, wearing a bat suit, and carrying some scuba gear from an early-morning  diving class. Marge and Denise, two other divers, are wit him, with their gear. They ad-lib "good-byes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need you. Andy's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always go with Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy) How was dive class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as always -- glub-glub, bubble- bubble, stroke-stroke. There sure is  some weird shit on the bottom of the  ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shells and lobsters and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly old garbage. Today we found a  '48 Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to play with the little  kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Go on, beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean mopes away while Andy and Mike get their boat ready sea.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW SEAN OFF THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Up on the street, where a pretty girl with a sexy face an provocative post-pubescent walk is asking him directions. He points down at the dock. The Girl, Jackie Peters, wave at her cousin, Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the boats has a portable radio going. It's playing some medium-hot salsa. Jackie does a couple of dance step on her way down the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? Quick -- I'm in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that's the cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here. I want you to meet  somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky. Lucky, lucky, lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the four teen-agers come together in a tight quartet, music rocks up and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later in the day, sailboats with bright colored sails and ornately painted hulls tack back and forth. Lots of chatt between boats, horseplay, splashing, and general good tim It's cruising, on water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Mike, Andy, Jackie and Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast does this go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the right wind, 15-20 knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sheets in, heeling the boat over in the stiff breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie screams in excitement; for a city girl, this is mo fun than a roller coaster.

dialogues.speaker: A RED CATAMARAN, "SIZZLER"
dialogues.text: overtaking Mike's boat. It's piloted by Larry Vaughn, Jr. the Mayor's Son; with him is his good friend, Bob Burnsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gangway, Turkies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's immediately a race between the red boat -- "Sizzler, and Mike's "Green Machine." The Kids ad-lib -- "Faster,"  "Lookout," "Gybe, gybe."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're carrying weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take your supercargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been supercargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny and Denise's boat cuts in, stealing the Sizzler's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, get out of our air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a passenger?

dialogues.speaker: THE SIZZLER AND FELIX
dialogues.text: Denise hops nimbly from one boat to the other as Danny sa tight as a tick to the red cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sailboats cutting up, cruising the harbor, the local  teen-agers partying with each other: --  Patrick and Lucy's Sol Cat, flying its hull. --  Susie's Laser heeled 'way over' in a stiff breeze. --  Polo and a pretty girl in his sloop, "Sea Witch." --  Timmy Weldon and Doug Fetterman playing catch-up in t respective boats, the Doughdish and the Inflatable. --  Marge in her Lightening, sailing close to Ed and Tina Tina's Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent, green-blue depths. A diver, Crosby, working the  bottom, running a search pattern. Another diver, Tom Andr running close. They signal to each other, and make anothe pass. Follow Tom Andrews as he skims the bottom, near the wreck the Orca, half-buried in the silt. A diver's line runs up and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbing on the surface are three boats: the Amity Police  launch, the deserted Elizabeth T., from Newport, flying a diver's flag, and the ScubaVue, a local diveboat operated Tom Andrews and his partner, Crosby; it has "Amity Aqua  Sports" lettered on it somewhere. Hendricks and Red are o the deck of the police boat, peering at the cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich or poor, it's nice to have money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure they split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens every season -- someone takes  off. Once we had a schooner for a  month while the owners went fox  hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden eruption in the water nearby startles them -- it Andrews, surfacing, holding up the underwater flash camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crosby pops up next to him, shows empty hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's it, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The divers head for their boat, Hendricks fires up his en and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is trying to reason with an indignant fat man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch the news, I can't watch  a ball game, I can't watch movies --  all I hear is that rotten kid with  his rotten radio... "Breaker,  Breaker..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can, but you're talking  about a federal jurisdiction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving in a huff) So call the FBI!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black, two sugars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. What else is out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One petty theft, one domestic  disturbance, and an exhibitionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the exhibitionist, you  handle the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Brody? I want you to do  something about my first husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is caught in the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, you have got to demand that  Grace Kinney keep her shades down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about enforcing the "No Parking"  ordinance on Beach Road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute, in a minute -- talk to  Mrs. Prendergast, please... WOMAN (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert keeps coming  around when I'm with  gentlemen friends and  he throws mud on their  cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to White Haired Man) Talk to me about Mrs. Kinney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her bedroom window faces my oldest  boy's bedroom, and she's teasing  him, dancing around in a towel, or  less...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks has entered, carrying the camera brought up fro the bottom by the divers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks. I want to go over your  reports and your Form 908.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go into Brody's inner office; the uproar continues b the door, but it's calm in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of a 908.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made it up. It means, "Get me  out of there." (notices the camera) What the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diver's camera. Tom Andrews brought  it up from under that abandoned  cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoned? It's a little early in  the season for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich people. Home port is Newport,  Rhode Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a $100,000 boat, I sure as  hell wouldn't leave it anchored alone  in the channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had a $100,000 boat there'd  be an investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks puts the camera in an informal "Lost & Foun sitting in the office. Brody makes the mistake of opening the door, revealing the White-Haired Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace Kinney is driving my boy to  distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks, get a description of that  dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brody) Chief Brody? I want to talk to you  about my daughter... she's 15, but  mature for her age... WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, I've been telling  Mrs. Prendergast that  it's no good just  talking about Albert,  she's got to do  something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brody turns to deal with the mess, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up at the surface, where a hull floats in silhoue against the daylight. There's a commotion, and a water sk drops into view. Then another one. Pale legs churn the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Amity Beach, a bilious green lap-straked boat is bobb in the water, the engine idling. Two girls are fooling ar the one in the water is Terry, the one driving the boat i Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see a dolphin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They like to play. We may see  some today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fumbles with her skis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops, almost lost one. Can't play  with the dolphins without skis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on... Okay, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane goes to the controls, and puts the engine into gear starting forward. Terry waves "okay," Diane opens up the  throttle, the boat surges forward, pulling Terry upright. A wake boils out from under her skis.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Ed and Tina are camped on a blanket, necking in the shelt of the dunes. There's a portable radio, a cooler with som beer, and some sandwiches -- a perfect afternoon alone. A the dune, behind them lies the ocean, where the girls' sk boat can be seen, raising a big wake. Tina disengages, an sits up, brushing sand out of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a break for a minute, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina stands, and looks out to the sea, where the boat is  towing Terry on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, can we do that? (no reaction) Can we go skiing? We can use my  Uncle's boat. Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you, everything's next week. I  want to go skiing soon. Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed grunts non-comittally. Tina takes a beer from the cool and goes up on the dune to watch Terry and Diane. She wav to them, and to someone down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old lady, Grace Witherspoon, is rocking on her porch,  also enjoying the view of young people enjoying themselve She acknowledges Tina's distant wave, and turns her atten back to the skiers.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIERS
dialogues.text: having a wonderful time. Terry is good, criss-crossing th wake, showing off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: rushing through the water, waving, stunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster! Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves at Diane, who leans over the controls, to coax  more speed out of the old engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: following the skis effortlessly, closing in on the turbul wake.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Terry whipping along; a fin raises near her. She glances it, waves, thinking it's a porpoise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porpoise! Look! A dolphin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fin slides low in the water, heading towards her. She puts the rope around her waist, leaving both hands free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing in on the wake, crossing it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The fin cuts across her path. Too late to maneuver, Terry hits the looming gray back of the Shark. The skis bump, l the water, Terry takes a spectacular spill. The rope arou her waist tows her helpless through the water, gagging he preventing her from shouting. She flounders as Diane slow the boat to see what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: turning back to see if her friend hit a submerged log or  hurt herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still doesn't realize the gravity of the situation -- she hasn't seen the fin.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: hysterical, pulling herself hand-over-hand up the rope, t to get to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing in on the thrashing figure.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Screaming, as the Shark rises from the deep and takes her Suddenly she's gone, a swirl of pink froth marking the wa where she went under.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Looking around for her friend, suddenly panicky. She pull the rope hard, and tumbles backward as it comes up with  nothing on it -- just a cleanly bitten end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Terry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the Shark appears, blood on its mouth, lunging up an butting the stern, jarring the engine loose. Fuel spills  from a ruptured line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! God, help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws things at the Shark, which slides back under t water.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Diane can be seen flailing in the boat, very distant scre floating across the water; at this range they sound like normal shrieks of teen-age girls having fun....

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: as the Shark hits from a fresh angle, this time taking a  chunk out of the boat, biting down with powerful jaws. Di hurls seat-cushions, oars, anything she can lay hands on. She fumbles desperately in a compartment, produces a flar pistol. She cocks it and fires point-blank at the shark.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: The flare hits, wet fuel glistening on the water and skin the Shark explodes in a sheet of flame.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: A last flash before the gasoline explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o-o-o-o-o...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheet of fire, she's in the middle, screaming, aflame, Shark forgotten. She falls into the water as the ruined b overturns and there's an oily explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Tina look up as they hear the distant "crump" of t boat blowing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Witherspoon looks up, startled by the sudden tragedy She gets up to go to the phone, indoors, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The launch is anchored at the site of the explosion, offs Red is fishing up bits of flotsam with a boathook. Hendri is on the radio, talking to the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find anyone out here. They  must've gone to the bottom, or drifted  with the current.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY ON SHORE
dialogues.text: He's on the porch of tile Witherspoon house, using his  portable walkie-talkie. Mrs. Witherspoon is waiting in th b.g. Nearby, we can see a sign: "BURIED CABLE: Call New Englan Light and Power Before Digging." The cable itself surface in a chain-link fenced enclosure, and climbs a power pole for distribution to the island. Ed and Tina are also ther having given statements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There should be bodies. Witnesses  say two people; one in the boat, one  skiing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I told you -- nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try dragging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long? Current's moving  everything around, and it's getting  dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on it. I don't care how long it  takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody turns to Ed and Tina, and takes out his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard this noise, like a 'boomp'  out there, and when we looked, there  was just this cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the explosion. One minute  they were having a wonderful time,  the next, bang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what could've done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody stares out at the quiet sea -- what's lurking under that calm surface?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's still looking past them, towards the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Brody -- can we go? Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gazes at the ocean, we hear the sound of a distant  siren, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance, siren wailing and red light flashing, drive on its melancholy way through the picturesque town.

dialogues.speaker: ABROAD THE POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: Hendricks has the winch in operation, the cable in his ha with big grappling hooks attached. The boat is lit by its powerful worklights. Hendricks heaves them out, watches a the current takes them, then puts the winch in gear, haul back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until we find something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the overtime, I'm  hungry. And cold. And most of all,  bored.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINCH CABLE
dialogues.text: It goes taut with a sudden strain.

dialogues.speaker: HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: He sees it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red moves to the winch, watching warily as it slows to a  near stall with the weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About damn time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a strain on the cable -- it's pulling the stern o the boat down as it struggles with the weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes...

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: lit by the harsh worklights on the deck of the launch. Th cable from the winch is taut, pulling something up from t black depths. What? The coupling appears, then the hook, an oily cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the release on the winch, and the cable whines as spins out and settles back on the bottom. Red jiggles the line, trying to free it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes here from Cable Junction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untangle it and let's go -- We don't  need a blackout on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the winch) Now you're talking. Let's get out of  here before we do find something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning, the Brody family is downstairs, each ge his own special breakfast. Mike gets cereal for himself a Sean, Ellen is cracking some soft-boiled eggs, Brody is  drinking coffee and smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to smoke so early in the  morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good with coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's a donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Fruit Loops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat Cheerios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You eat Cheerios. I want Fruit Loops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat Cheerios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you guys doing today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates Sean) I don't know about him -- I'm going  down to the dock, maybe go sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is there to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could work out at the beach,  make a few bucks for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to make up your own mind  about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my day book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen passes them on the way to the den to look for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to work all the time,  it's his vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Silvera enters from the service porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning -- everyone up early  today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows Ellen into the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is rummaging around the papers on the end table, lo for her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take a half day and  clean this junk up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I'm in the middle of a  boating accident, I got only four  regular cops and one secretary, and  a Chief Deputy who is constantly  fiddling with the police boat. He's  another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One what? (she finds the book) Ah-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat nut. What is it about this place  that makes everyone a freak for  boating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an island. (she pecks him on the  cheek) Got to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads out the door for the office. Mike approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about tennis? Riding? Fixing up  old cars? Bartending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartending? I'm 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, not bartending. Why on the  water every day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, humor the old man -- just be  careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going) I'll be careful. I'll see y'later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike passes through on his way out, nodding to Mrs. Silve who acknowledges his passage.  Brody is close on his heel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out if it's rough or  anything, huh? We've had a lot of  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door slams behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go with you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay with Mrs. Silvera, Tootsie.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean nods, resigning himself to the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean) You can come with me to the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Silvera nods, and pours Sean a glass of milk. Brody  sighs, and heads out the door. Sean calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Daddy. I'm going to be careful,  all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting snug and ship-shape on Mike's Green Machine are M Andy, Brooke, and Jackie. They are heeled over in a brisk wind, making good headway; sailing nearby in the b.g. are Patrick and Lucy and Donny and Denise, in their boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from her boat) Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, out a ways. Maybe the lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No big thing, we'll see who's out  there, maybe picnic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some stuff at the store. Ed  and Tina are going to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, they would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an island, near here, with a  lighthouse. We sometimes hang out  there, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I got some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her big floppy bag, revealing the top half of a jug of Mountain Red. Brooke slides over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) The lighthouse is a make-out spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I really want to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to fool around with Mike? (Jackie shrugs) Well, I'm not doing anything with  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates Andy, who pretends great indifference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I will, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy does about a triple take before he regains his cool. Mike concentrates on his sailing, Jackie grins an impish, vixen grin, Brooke shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spectacular view from the top of the old lighthouse, show ocean, sandy beach, some of the Kids' catamarans pulled u on the sand, other pleasure boats cruising in the b.g. Ed and Tina are running down the stairs, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back my hat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double nope!

dialogues.speaker: THE SAND
dialogues.text: where Andy, Mike, Jackie, and Brooke are camped around a  blanket listening to a portable radio. Ed and Tina run by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd they decide to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too hot in the lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too hot for those two? I can't believe  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I don't know about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. So why aren't they doing  it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a little round of giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe by now they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're moving pretty fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON ED & TINA running towards a dune and over it.

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE SHAPE
dialogues.text: in f.g., covered with birds. Ed and Tina appear over the  crest of a dune, and the frame explodes in a flurry of  seagulls, suddenly disturbed. The whir and drumbeat of wi and the shrieking of the gulls is a jarring shock.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yech!

dialogues.speaker: HER POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: The huge hulk of a beached, decomposing dead whale, a few birds still pecking at scraps of blubber and entrails. Bi festering red holes mark its sides.

dialogues.speaker: SAND AND WHALE
dialogues.text: From the top of the lighthouse, we can see a group of  interested spectators, clustered around the whale like an at a picnic. A few more boats are beached and riding at a just off the shore, including the Amity police boat. Three Ants are walking towards the crowd, one of them  gesturing.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, HENDRICKS AND A WOMAN
dialogues.text: She's Lureen Elkins, a marine biologist from the Oceanogr Institute, and she's skeptical. Brody is the ant whose  antennae were waving in the long shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I heard about it, I called  you. This thing is big!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His arms indicate big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we've looked, we'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves forward to clear the crowd. Some kids are poking the massive hulk with sticks. A tourist couple is snappin away with a Polaroid SX-70. The whole mess stinks, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move back, please... back off...  open it up a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd edges back, giving way to Brody and Elkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? What'd I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: THE WHALE
dialogues.text: Brody is holding a handkerchief to his nose as he approac the dead thing, indicating a huge open wound on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She produces a tape measure and gives one end to Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the tip of the snout, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elkins is measuring the length of the creature. She calls off numbers to Hendricks, who is officiously writing it a down, repeating numbers as he hears them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Length, 22 feet, 8 inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's check the bite radius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite radius. You know, the size of  the mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whale's mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shark's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody pitches his voice low, so that the crowd won't list

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark that did this. It was a  shark, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that, do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what we're here to find  out, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't tell me my job, and I won't  tell you about yours, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear you if you're going to  whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to join the kids as they slip through the crowd return to their blanket, ad-libbing good-byes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike) You stay here a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be over by the lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there. Wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang around, waiting for him. Elkins has reclaimed  Brody's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a shark. But maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know a little bit about  sharks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that this was probably a Great  White Shark. Car-cadon... Caradan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles for the correct Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping out) Carcharadon Carcharias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there one in these waters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think there might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this big fish has been bitten  by some other big fish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mammal, not a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, don't quibble with me. I want  to know if a Great White Shark did  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Probably? Look, sharks  are attracted by blood, and thrashing  around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is a new one) Sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound. Like sonar, or radar. They  home in on irregular sounds, unusual  sounds, any rhythmic low-frequency  vibration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's one around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. These wounds could've  been inflicted 30 miles out to sea,  or more. None of them are immediately  fatal. Currents could've carried the  body 10 miles further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiming in) We got a helluva tide this month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just keep that crowd back,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fidgeting) Pop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay right here. You're going in  with me.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AND MIKE
dialogues.text: As Elkins examines the whale, calling her observations to Hendricks. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came out in my boat. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy can sail in it. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a date! BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll understand. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids have moved a little closer to hear what's going between father and son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to discuss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elkins crosses to Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's either a Great White, or another  killer whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when it's like this. This animal  has been ashore for 10, 12 hours,  and drifting for a day, at least.  Every little nibbler in the sea's  taken a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- can Great White Sharks  communicate? Send out signals, or  something? You know, take revenge,  sense an enemy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous -- Sharks don't  take things personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody turns on him.  This at least, is something he can d something about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more sailing. You come back with  me, and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tie up at the town dock, don't  worry, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later, Mikey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, bye... (ad lib)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn and Brody enter, walking through the spare, empty  town meeting hall, towards the conference table. They are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm showing summer rentals. We got a  helluva season going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have got to talk, and we have got  to talk alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, I don't know how to say this,  but I think we got a shark problem.  A real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn stares at him, then unlocks the door to his privat office -- "Mayor" -- and leads Brody in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, expensively furnished in antiques, with a few symb of Amity boosterism cluttering one wall: a photo of the b featuring a shark tower; an architect's rendering of the Holiday Inn, some charts and graphs showing upward progre a few stills of businessmen's luncheons, plaques, awards, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Look -- I've got some  missing persons, fatalities, evidence  of a large predator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has seen a shark -- no fin,  no bites, nothing. Be realistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a feeling. I have to act on it --  you can understand that, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I can, but can't it wait?  These things cost money, and this  town doesn't have much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have done something -- hell, we  damn near went broke putting up a  shark watch tower on the beach --  it's the only one in 2000 miles,  y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I stood by while you told the  people from Ramada and Marriott that  if they put up a hotel they'd need  $800,000 worth of steel net around  their beaches! In New England? We  all lost on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, when we build up our tax  base a little, you can have everything  you want; right now, the town's broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Larry -- there's good reason. Those water skiers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) A tragedy. But that was a boating  accident; no bites, no sharks, nothing  but a boating accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of them are still missing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always deaths in these waters  that never turn up. Are they all  shark victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's overstated his case, and he realizes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Bullshit? I'll give you bullshit --  there's a dead whale out there with  bites all over it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back) What am I, an ass? When you called  me, I called Elkins, and her bosses.  Nothing she saw is proof of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back in control) Don't push it this time. If you do,  it won't turn out the way you want,  I guarantee you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men study each other for a long moment. Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the door for Brody, who walks out as Vaughn lags behind, locking up his sanctum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is alone in the jeep, headed for the safety of home and family. He drives past the town's billboard: it's cov with an architect's rendering of the Amity Holiday Inn. T sign reads: "WHEN IN AMITY, ENJOY THE HOLIDAY INN." Plastered across it is an added streamer: "NOW OPEN." Bar visible underneath are older notices: "UNDER CONSTRUCTION and "OPENING IN JUNE." As Brody passes the sign, he impulsively swings off the m road and heads down towards the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is on restless patrol, checking the water's edge as continues on home. As he drives along, he sees: a clambak some teen-agers in a group, necking and dancing; and a fe solitary surfcasters and fishermen. The beach is deserted, the sun is setting, and Brody and jeep have the sand to themselves. It's then that he sees  something:

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: A big bow section of a ruined, burnt boat is bobbing in t surf just off the beach ahead. It's a piece of the  waterskiers' boat; Brody heads towards it.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURF
dialogues.text: As Brody slows his jeep just short of the water, and gets out to look at the flotsam. His shoes get wet. He backs u onto dry sand, then tries to edge closer to examine this  object. It bobs up and down in the surf; Brody makes "Get in here motions. The junk resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, give a guy a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He takes off his shoes and socks, and rolls his trouser legs. A silly sight. He wades into the water  after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Here boy. Come to Poppa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It eludes him, and he flounders after it. A big wave brea across his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo! Cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's almost there, it's just beyond his reach, he's got i he's lost it, he has it again, it's slippery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib) Come here. Come on, Sweetheart. You  bastard. A little closer... Here  y'go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, he's got it ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exultant) Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: As he grabs the ruined wood, and pulls it towards him.  Suddenly, the mass of wreckage breaks apart, and somethin lunges out of the mess and into Brody.

dialogues.speaker: "THE THING"
dialogues.text: Brody is suddenly pinned under a soggy charred horror; th gory remains of Diane, burnt beyond recognition,: flesh p away, discolored, charred, ruined by days in salt water. screams, and scrabbles in the wet sand, trying to get out the dreadful clutches of the half-human thing he's dredge from the water.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Extricating himself, puking, retching, splashing water on his face, washing his hands frantically, just behind him, The Thing lying on the sand, a gruesome joke played by th sea.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Macro close on a pharmaceutical bottle of Sodium Cyanide, from which a syringe is withdrawing a healthy dose. Follo the syringe and reveal Brody, working at his desk in the  deserted office. He is injecting the deadly chemical into some jacketed .38 hollow-point ammunition; a dozen cartri are lined up in neat array, he is filling the last of the sealing the points with wax from a burning red candle. Th radio scanner is monitoring the local police band: routin reports faintly in the b.g. -- a slow night in pre-season Amity.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: As a sound at the door makes him look up. He hides the od gear as Hendricks enters, starched and crisp in his unifo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you at the funeral home.  Santos said you were here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't miss much. Christ, what a  mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman passenger on the boat that  blew up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an awkward pause. Brody sees the box with the div stuff sitting where it was left earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one -- from the wreck. You  brought it up, did you look inside  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks' guilty look confirms he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell -- might be  something worth seeing. Take it  somewhere and see if there's film in  it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching on) If there is, develop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy rummages in the locker, happy to be on the tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know just where to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the drugstore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not, They're closed. Phil  Fogarty's place. He'll do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drugstore's closed? What the  hell time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-thirty, ten maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- I'm late for dinner... Close  up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he runs for the door, the speed-loaders with the Cyan bullets safely in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the door) Oh yeah -- I'm expecting a long  distance call, very important. Give  them my home phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody pats his pockets to make sure the speed-loaders are safe inside, then exits. As Hendricks watches him go,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's jeep pulls up, and he gets out, beat. He is slouc towards the door when he hears the phone ring inside. He  perks up, and starts to move faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is on the phone in the den as Brody enters the hous The Kids are on the floor in front of the TV, playing an  electronic video game that pings and beeps softly under t following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Thank you. I'll tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging up) Sort of -- Matthew Hooper is aboard  the research vessel Aurora, presently  in the Antarctic Ocean, and won't be  in radio range until half-past next  spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts upstairs, casually concealing the towel-wrapped package of gun and ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Hooper coming to dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not till next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes upstairs, Ellen waits a few beats, then follows h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody comes up the stairs and goes into the bedroom, wher he carefully puts the gun in the bed table. Ellen finds h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi -- How was dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, perfect -- a 75 per cent family  affair. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Santos' place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both know what that means -- the morgue. Brody goes  into the bathroom and starts scrubbing his hands compulsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen follows Brody, watches as he washes under too-hot w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said. Is there any of  that hand cleaner stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the little brush there. Why were  you at Santos'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found one of the missing victims  from that boat deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike comes up the stairs, and is starting into his room w Brody spots him; Sean is just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come here a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shrugs and crosses to his father; Sean whizzes past into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He expects something: this is a formal audience with the  Head of The House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got something for you to do  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of had plans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing? (Mike nods) Forget it. You're beached. Grounded.  No more boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No backtalk! I spoke to Upton, at  the beach, and he's got a job for  you there. You can work until school  starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted a job, he's got one. I  want to see that boat out of the  water by tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Sean's door opening as he peeps into the hall to s what the fuss is about.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN'S DOOR
dialogues.text: It opens a few inches, he looks out at the grownups and h brother, decides he wants no part of this, and quietly cl the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night. Out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mike silently storms into his room, not-so-silently slamm the door as he exits. From inside the room, loud rock mus muffled behind the door -- an expression of teen-age  rebellion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so loud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music lowers its volume. Brody turns to go into the  bedroom, to take his shoes off, to go to bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're going to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the bed) In the city, it happened all the  time -- some Kid o.d.'s on a rooftop,  top, a drunk gets cut in pieces under  the Brooklyn local, old people die  alone in shitty apartments and three  weeks later someone calls the cops  because of the smell and the flies.   Call the cops. What are we, immune?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was bad, wasn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn smell is always the same. (he shudders at the  recollection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to be able to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think so. (he raises his voice) Mike! Keep it down, for chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen gets up, and quietly closes the door. The upstairs  hallway is empty, the doors closed. The Brody household  compartmented and closed for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar striped cabanas flank the white sands; there a crowd of midweek seasonal tourists and locals oblivious the tall steel tower that dominates the beach. A classy van outfitted for passengers pulls into the park area, followed by Vaughn's Cadillac; the parking attendan waves them into a preferential area, where they disembark Vaughn, Peterson, Ellen, and some more prospects, includi a woman named Bryant and her daughter, Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the town beach; the  development naturally has its own  private access, but I wanted you to  see the concession area. Look at  that sand -- like sugar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoops up a handful of the fine powder. Ellen directs attention of the photographers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the summer, the sun sets right  there... (she points) Over the water. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) I'll say hello for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen nods, preoccupied. Vaughn strolls away, headed in t direction of the cabanas. Mary Nichols, a local Selectwom emerges from behind the counter of one of the concessions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello -- selling some more of the  good life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece here, a piece there, it all  adds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband's been here all morning.  What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) His job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Brody, dressed in township workman's coveralls, i repainting some flaking woodwork. Sean is happily mixing  paint. Vaughn joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad got you working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues his chore, without enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where your dad is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses briskly to where Peterson is finishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
