dialogues.text: And if you have any questions about  recreational possibilities, Ellen  Brody here will be happy to answer  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Len, can I see you a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peterson excuses himself and joins the Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got a couple of live ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's riding his tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE TOWER
dialogues.text: sweeping the water with binoculars, restless eyes trying scan everything, a grim watchman high over the heads of t unseeing crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WATER
dialogues.text: Larry Vaughn, Jr. comes skimming in close to the surf. Bo is handling the sheets, Larry is giving young Jackie sail lessons -- at the moment he's showing her how the tiller  works.  He's on her like glue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fun! Can we go faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) Trim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob does, Larry trims the main, and the hull lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snuggles in Larry's arms. He waves to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie waves without seeing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Vaughn waves back, preoccupied. Near him, Mike Brody look up, his face grim, jealous, and now a little nuts. He spl paint onto the wood with angry abandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peterson) Wave to my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving) How the hell do we get him down from  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe nobody will notice. Let's get  them back in the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bryant approaches them, tugging her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee wants to know what that man is  doing way up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's, ah, watching. A lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a precocious little  girl) It's a shark tower. I saw one in  Florida. He's looking for sharks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an observation platform. That's  our Chief of Police. He's just  checking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, it's used for, ah, bird  watching. Nature observation. Weather  measurements, that sort of thing. (a little desperate) Ellen, we're running late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Folks, if we could get back  on, we'll show you the country club,  and stop for lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the mention of lunch, the prospects, all hungry, begin flocking back into the van. Peterson herds them along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The country club has an 18-hole  course, putting greens, and twelve  tennis courts...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE TOWER
dialogues.text: still scanning. His body suddenly tenses. There's somethi out there. He mashes his binoculars to his eyes, trying t get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW, (PROCESS)
dialogues.text: Through the binoculars, something big and black, moving u the buoys and into the swimming area.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AGAIN
dialogues.text: He can't believe it. But looking past him, we can see it  with the unaided eye: a seething dark mass, moving throug the water towards the unprotected bathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Out of the water! Everyone out of  the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can hear him. A few little faces look up, unable t catch what he's saying. He starts climbing down the ladde shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the water! Tell everyone  to get out! Now! Out of the water!

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON, VAUGHN, AND NICHOLS
dialogues.text: reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recalling another  panic) Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN, MIKE, AND SEAN
dialogues.text: Looking up, startled at Brody's sudden panic.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: The dark mass almost on top of the swimmers, who are star to look around. Most of them are oblivious to what's happ on shore.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW BRODY
dialogues.text: as his feet hit the sand and he starts running for the wa fumbling for his gun and the speed-loader with the cyanid bullets. He is bumping into people, knocking little kids  over, stepping on blankets and umbrellas, a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the water! Now! Everyone!

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN
dialogues.text: Running too, half-stumbling, half-believing, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Moving after her husband, while Mike steadies Sean, holdi the impulsive kid back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing something) Martin! No!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AGAIN
dialogues.text: The gun is out now, he's trying draw a bead on the shape the water; chest heaving, he tries to steady his shaky gr People see the gun and scream, throwing themselves flat o the sand, running, some of them going into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't go in! Stay out! Stay clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires. Again. Bullets ricochet off the water, howling  towards the horizon. Real panic now. Four more shots. Reloading, ejected rounds falling bright into the sand, B on his knees, fumbling with bullets.

dialogues.speaker: A LIFEGUARD
dialogues.text: standing on his platform, shocked, watching the Chief of  Police fumbling with his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bluefish! It's a school of  bluefish! Chief! It's bluefish!

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: It is bluefish -- a tight mass of them, churning up the w in a dark, dense group. The swimmers look around, confuse by the shots and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish! Anyone got a net?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone get me a rod and reel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter defuses the tension in the water; bathers move  around, some getting closer to see the fish, others leavi the water to join friends and families on the sand.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: where Brody is now standing, panting, coming down as a cr collects at a safe distance around him: Ellen emerges fro group that includes Vaughn, Peterson, and Nichols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm sorry. False alarm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious crowd murmurs as they watch this lunacy. Brody  realizes he's fired his weapon, that spent shells litter sand at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's all over, go on, it's  over. No trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody drops to his knees, fumbling for the cyanide bullet in his gun, trying to put things in order, scrabbling in sand for the empty shells. The crowd is curious and embarrassed. Some turn away, oth drift back to their blankets, talking about what's just  happened, others stare rudely. Brody is coming apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, everything's all  right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean emerges from the crowd, and helps his daddy pick up bullets, Ellen moves to disperse the rudely curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, everyone... Mrs. Bryant,  Len, please...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AND SEAN
dialogues.text: He sees Sean, his eyes fill with tears, and he grabs the in a fierce hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hurriedly called meeting of the town's Selectmen is in  session: Vaughn, Peterson, and three others: Kaiser, an o man still in his grocery clerk's apron; Sansom; and Nicho the woman on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody says he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've been out there. You  should've seen him waving that gun,  like a maniac. There were shots fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought he had a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not rational behavior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people were there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred! Literally hundreds. What  are they going to say about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vaughn) Larry, I'm a businessman, trying to  make a buck like anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it can't be done like that. The  man's a menace, plain and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what am I supposed to do? It's  done, it's over. We have to deal  with the consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're here to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's go into my office,  where we can have a little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUGHN'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: as the selectmen troop into the cramped quarters. Vaughn  deliberately closes the door as they find seats around th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we have a quorum, and  informally, I suggest we call this  meeting an executive session and  dispense with minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody, alone, is sitting at his desk, morosely studying a little gold statuette of a pistol marksman. What's done i done, and Brody is trying to figure out how to live with The phone rings, is answered in the other room. The buzze sounds. Brody picks up his end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly, no calls, please... (she insists) Okay, okay. (he punches a button) Hello... Phil? Fogarty? What  pictures... I'll be right down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the phone and gets up to go, suddenly posse with a purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the equipment, clutter and proofs, some shots of the holidome opening, drying on wires. Phil Fogarty, the indi fat man and town photographer, is locking the door behind impatient Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you did, but that  kid stopped. I haven't heard one  peep, not one 'breaker breaker' for  days. Believe me, it's a pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something about a camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure -- Jeff Hendricks brought  in this camera, see, from underwater,  and I didn't know how to get it open,  but my brother-in-law, in Montauk,  he works at a hi-fi store, and they  sell cameras, so he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Did you get any pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, I did, that's the funny  thing. You can't tell much from the  negatives, I was going to blow 'em  up. Here's a test I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out an 8 x 10 proof, Brody snatches it from him.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: Brody stares down at it. Sure enough, the ghostly outline of the Orca, underwater, a diver on the deck making a ges at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. That boat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad -- that's a real fast lens,  probably 1.4. Look at the diffusion,  though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see -- you got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Phil, don't jerk me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay -- stand over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures, Brody steps to one side of a table with some big enamel pans for washing and developing prints. Phil  switches to a red light, and takes some printing paper,  putting it under the enlarger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --  Enlarger light going on. --  Timer ticking, the hand turning. --  Quick negative images: water, boat, diver, hand, boat again, tantalizing fragments of the opening sequence proj on the enlarger's flat base. --  Hypo and Developer sloshing in a pan under Phil's han --  Brody staring down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly gaining contrast in a pan of developer, a print o what at first looks like seaweed, then is unmistakably th grinning jaws of the Great White.

dialogues.speaker: SUBLIMINAL FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: A quick nightmare vision of Brody, alone in a sinking Orc trapped in a battered cabin interior; a Great White crash through the glass, its head huge as it lunges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The close-up detail of this otherwise blurred and unreada photo is unmistakably a detail from a very close view of snapping jaws of a Great White; if you hadn't seen it as memory, it would make no sense at all. For Brody, the mea is all too clear; for anyone who's never seen the monster face-to-face, it's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) That one there. That one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil's hands, holding plastic tongs, gently slosh the pri in the bath. The shark's features are indistinguishable f the surrounding detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody walks into view, and starts up the steps into the t hall, already lit from within. He's carrying a large enve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Selectmen (Kaiser, Sansom, Nichols), Len Peterson, an Vaughn are seated informally around the big table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Speak of the devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody enters, carrying the envelope with the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you guys were all together.  I got something for you. Proof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, this is kind of an official  meeting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Look at this ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles with the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief -- the Board of Selectmen has  a question only you can answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Jeff Hendricks qualified to fill  in as an interim Chief of Police in  your absence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temporarily? Uh... sure... The  question's out of left field. Why  are they asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Jeff could handle things? He knows  the routine, he has the authority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came up during the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I just got this from Phil  Fogarty. It was in the camera  belonging to the missing divers. It  proves I was right, all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the picture down in front of them. They bend ov to study it, pass it around, look at it. KAISER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seaweed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shark! A Great White! Jesus,  it's right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches up the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as before, an ambiguous pattern of light and dark; n proof of anything without Brody's inner vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing I can see.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: waving the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you all, blind? It's a shark.  Look -- teeth, jaw, gills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're damn right that's what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just don't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sansom and Kaiser agree, ad lib, "That's nothing..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, it could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) What the hell does it take to make  sense to you numbskulls? Jesus, it's  right there in front of you. I know  what a goddamn shark looks like,  I've been through it, don't you  understand? I've seen this sonofabitch  before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Selectmen look at each other in the face of Brody's  agitation. Tempers are running high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you seen before? This is  nothing. Seaweed. Mud. Something in  the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be reasonable, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vaughn) Forget it, he won't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing to discuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing up) Will you listen to this man? Will  you just listen to him? (to Brody) You really caused a panic on a public  beach, you shoot up the place, God  knows who could've been injured --  what if somebody decides to sue us?  That could ruin us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what it is? Dollars? Money?  I'll pay for it. Take it out of my  salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't make enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I don't make as much money as  some bullshit rip-off artists around  here, but I don't work the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I don't like all that grab- ass and heavy breathing with my wife,  it means I know who's out to screw  me here, and it means that I know  something none of you know because  I've been there -- and I don't want  to go through that horror again.  Ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, could you wait here for a  few minutes while we make up our  minds about something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, whatever it's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Selectmen file into Vaughn's office, leaving Brody al in the room. The last one in the door very carefully make sure it's tightly shut. Brody sits alone at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are sitting there, deliberating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't mention his personal attack  on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen him like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Hendricks is qualified, you heard  that from his own mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made a motion and it was already  seconded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (official) Very well then. It is moved and  seconded that Martin Brody be relieved  of his duties as Chief of Police,  his contract with the township be  terminated, and that Jeff Hendricks  be appointed Acting Chief in the  interim. Those in favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the hands go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone opposed, or is it unanimous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn's hand goes up, the sole dissent. They stare at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I respect his  convictions. The motion is carried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the door, and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin? Could you come in please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police jeep pulls up and stops; although the engine's shut down, Brody still sits quietly inside the car. Then hand appears at the window, and he drops an empty beer ca onto the lawn. Clink. After a while, he drops another beer can, then another, u the "clinks" tell us he's polished off a six-pack on the home. Not too steady on his feet, Brody climbs out of the car and starts for the door to his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is working at her desk in the den. She is looking  towards the door, expectantly -- it's been an unusually l pause between car arrival and husband arrival. Brody ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I closed a sale today, without  Len. That's $1200 commission, if the  papers go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great too. Gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a long look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look about 22 years old sitting  there. Like you were doing homework...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to join her, bumping into some furniture in the d lit room. Ellen has a beer and sandwich half-finished on desk; Brody takes a healthy swallow from the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensitive) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooohh, nothing. I just got fired,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the photo sloppily on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you were fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's what I meant. Fired.  Canned. Out on my fanny. The Selectmen  just made Hendricks the new Chief of  Police. Just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of today? The beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expansively) No sweat. A blessing in disguise.  Back to the city, you can go to  Bloomingdale's without waiting six  hours for the ferryboat... we're  surrounded by water here, you realize  that? Me, surrounded by water...  Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that! We're not going any place.  You love it here. Tell me what the  hell happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showed them the photo, showed them  the goddamn Shark, big as life. They  didn't see it. Not like me. Not like  the poor son-of-a-bitch who snapped  this li'l picture... He's out there,  somewhere... I shot off my gun, shot  off my big mouth, so they fired me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the photo) Honey, this is nothing... I don't  know what it is. What did they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going on) ...Everybody wants the job. No one  wants the authority. Except Hendricks.  Fine. He can go out there in that  precious boat, and when he looks  whitey in his big mouth he can just  call me. Call me in New York... tell  him to kiss my ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing his pain) They have no right to treat you like  that. You've given them everything.  For four years, you've protected  this town, the people on this  island...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fired me! (at Ellen) I'm not a hysterical man. I'm  responsible. I know what I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try. Goddamnit, I tried... Now,  I'm tired... I can't keep fighting  it... I'm too tired... I'm... I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's slipping under; the beers and the day have finall overcome him. He slumps in Ellen's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk is what you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eases him onto the couch, tucking a comforter over hi inert shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy... Easy...

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Sean comes down the stairs, sleepy, in his pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is dad home? I heard something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes into the darkened den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Go back upstairs. Daddy's  sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean finds the photo, and stares at it idly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, sweetheart. Seaweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes him by his sleepy hand and leads him out of the room, leaving Brody tucked in on the couch, dead to the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Amity teen-ager's hangout -- a newsstand and  pinball arcade with a minimal refreshment counter where s drinks and submarine sandwiches are dispensed. A jukebox blaring some n.d. rock music. Present are Donnie, Doug, T Bob, Larry Vaughn Jr., Brooke, Marge, Denise, Jane, Andy, and Mike. The boys are passing around hot-rod van and cus boat magazines; the girls are looking at Silver Screen, T Beat, People, and Time. Andy and Mike are at the counter, splitting a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a book) That's what I want -- a gaff rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaff rigged? Why not a staysail  schooner? Go anywhere. Look at this --  the Mayan, an Alden schooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike -- I saw your dad over at  the town hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Did he really freak out at the beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's all bullshit. Anyone want  to play pong for money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one does. There's a bustle at the door, and some coupl enter from the movies: Patrick and Lucy, Ed and Tina, Pol and Jackie. There are a lot of ad-lib greetings;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather go the lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone want to go the lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? At night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Tomorrow. Early, spend the day.  My folks left two cases of beer in  the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Got it in my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All-right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a general ad-lib agreement to organize a day's sa picnic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might still be painting  the restrooms at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone want a coke or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break up into pairs and trios, some going for the so fountain, others hanging out by the magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to go out to the lighthouse  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fun, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you and Brooke could come over  to the town beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Everybody's going sailing.  If you don't want to take me, just  say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it. My dad told me not to  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do everything your parents tell  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'll be on the dock at eight. (to the gang) Eight o'clock, everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ad lib agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Mike) I really want to to be there. (to the crowd) Who's bringing the wine? And who's  got a quarter for the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke takes Mike aside, as Jackie goes to the jukebox. Larry is right there with a quarter, standing next to her they select a tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just likes to tease. I think she  really likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some rock music starts, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is asleep under the covers, Brody, still in his clo from the night before, is sprawled on top; obviously he's stumbled upstairs sometime during the night. There's a no down the hall, from Mike's room. Brody stirs, but doesn't wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is holding a lamp that's almost fallen -- the noise just heard. He's almost dressed, but not quite satisfied  with his image in the mirror. He takes off his clean shir and checks a more comfortable, worn shirt. A brief sniff make sure it's okay for another day, and he puts it on; h tiptoes to the hall, where a noise stops him in his track

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is frozen in his part-opened bedroom door. Sean's do opens, and little Sean, also fully dressed, comes sneakin out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) You're going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) I want to go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!  Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even louder) Michael...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Close your door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean does, and happily tiptoes with exaggerated stealth t Mike; the two of them start downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Sean are walking away towards the road into t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody emerges from the bathroom, dressed in sweatshirt, a cutoffs: no uniform today. He starts downstairs, stopping only to look into Mike's room. It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, America...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grin crosses his face -- "My son, the Don Juan..." He g downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody enters from upstairs. He heats coffee. Ellen enters dressed for work. He pours two cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you going to do today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn in the car. Clean my desk,  explain things to our sons, then  maybe get shit-faced and punch your  boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't rush into it -- we may need  the income.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours the coffee, they drink it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike left early. Couldn't wait to  make out. Must be a morning man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen and Brody sip their coffee quietly for a few moment Mrs. Silvera arrives, carrying groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Anything special today? ELLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's not up yet. You  know what he likes,  just some Fruit Loops  and milk. No candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie. He's my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie. Okay. Ask him if he needs  an apprentice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody and Ellen are at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids are into their boats, fitting out for a day of  recreational offshore sailing. Mike and Andy are readying his Tornado, while Sean gets in the way. In the b.g.,  Hendricks can be seen puttering around on the Amity polic boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're beached, why are we doing  this? For practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are we futzing around the  dock? We can make a few bucks working  at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean knocks something over, Mike snaps at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- if you're going to get in  the way, you can just go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in the way. Andy, am I in  the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge joins them, scooping Sean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy giving you any trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him down in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean) You want to go out in my boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you take him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've just made someone very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge and Sean go over to her Lightening. Brooke and Jack come down the dock, dressed for sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! Are you going out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go out if I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to the lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could give you a dozen good reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, don't say I didn't remind  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there room on your boat for all  of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks: Andy, Jackie, Brooke, himself... Timmy moves sensing the chance of a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're pretty crowded, and I  don't know when we're leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timmy makes his move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (to Andy) That's okay -- I'll go with Timmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks towards his boat, looking back for him to  follow. He's dumbstruck by his sudden good fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan-tas-tic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs to join her, untying mooring lines like crazy; th together again at last for the first time. Andy is left  shuffling with Mike and Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she plops down in Mike's boat, ready to be taken.  Anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie flashes him one of her pouty little smiles. Why br one heart when you can break two? Or more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is glaring. The message is clear, if unspoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell. For you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy joins them.  Mike casts off, while Andy helps, and J sits there, looking cute.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY AND BOB
dialogues.text: watching what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said she was going  with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go sailing, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casting off) Want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to swim home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets the message and shuts up. The Sizzler fills its  sails, and points out of the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: THE HARBOR
dialogues.text: Lots of day-sailing Kids, a few bigger, adult boats, some working fishermen and sport fishers; a typical recreation boating mix. The Kids are finding the same general direct pointing out of the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sails being trimmed. --  Brooke and Timmy, staring into each other's eyes as h sets a course straight for the lighthouse. --  Larry, lifting a hull, almost losing Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids' boats, in a loose bunch, slipping out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: The dive class boat, isolated near the channel, a group o Kids in wet suits and tanks assembled with three adult  instructors: Tom Andrews, Crosby, and Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews and his assistant instructor, Sparky, are address the class, when Mike and Andy's "Green Machine" sails by, close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Nicholas! You're supposed to be  in class!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today I'm staying topside. You dive  for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for lobster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Find one for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With butter, if they got any...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews dismisses them with a good-natured wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, turkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to his class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky will take you down today. If  everyone's got a buddy, we'll drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class dutifully lines up and starts going in, while i the b.g. the Kids sailboats head out to sea. Andrews' two partners, Crosby and Sparky, get ready to follow the clas over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrews) Let's get some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over, Andrews following. Sparky is with the class signaling "Down;" they submerge like clumsy seals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class, paired up, is drifting down; Sparky offering  encouragement as they descend. Andrews and Crosby are alr disappearing, swimming away with strong kicks.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING ANDREWS AND CROSBY
dialogues.text: as they go over the edge of a shelf and drop into darker, deeper waters. Crosby checks his depth, his watch, looks  around...

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: far above him, the class, going about their business. Below him, murk, depth, and suddenly, a big lunker bass. Andrews sees it, too.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANDREWS
dialogues.text: Assuming Crosby is following, he takes off, following the big lunker. Crosby, hung up in some minor equipment probl misses seeing him go. The two men are separated. Follow  Andrews as he twists and turns after the bass, going deep losing him in the rocks, suddenly rounding a boulder, and meeting, almost face-to-face, horror:

dialogues.speaker: BELOW HIM THE SHARK
dialogues.text: The Great White Shark, taking the striper in a single gul it's looking up at Andrews with one glassy doll's eye; it turns to face him directly, and we see the scar; ugly, re and black, charred flesh from jaw back on the right side, eyes and teeth gleaming like raw bone in the massive, unc face. Andrews' mouth clamps violently on his mouthpiece, then g wide as he screams in fear into the water. Finning backwa he ditches his weights, gulps for air, and yanks the cord his safety vest. It balloons out, and pulls him up, surgi towards the surface. The mouthpiece, useless, falls away  from his lips. Eyes closed, hose dangling, Andrews hurtles upward, holdi his breath in a final, fatal panic, passing a startled Cr

dialogues.speaker: THE DIVERS
dialogues.text: look over at the rocketing ascent. What's wrong? Sparky  signals "up," and they begin to carefully follow him towa the surface. Crosby's already surfacing.

dialogues.speaker: DECK OF THE DIVING BOAT
dialogues.text: Andrews is on his side, bloody froth on his lips. One of class is clinging to his legs, trying to arrest his  convulsions. Sparky is holding his shoulders, trying to  administer mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us in! For Christ's sake, get us  in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his arms, Andrews writhes, pain knotting his limbs. Behind them, in the water, the fin surfaces, and casually turns towards... the ocean. The Shark is headed for the s And for the now distant Kids in their sailboats, dotting horizon in their familiar bright colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are alone. In the middle distance, the rest of the K sails can be seen, headed for the lighthouse in the dista The Sandpiper's sails are luffing, they're making no head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to tack, or just leave her  pointed up like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snuggling close) Just like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about sailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tide's running. It'll take us to  the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take us to Budapest if you're  not careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is lashing the rudder as they continue to drift with t current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles in a cooler chest, produces a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be there when we get there.  Might even have a fire started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we going to do in the mean  time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. We'll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the wine into the two paper cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first, a little juice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her) Mmmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resisting) Wait a minute. Promise me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you'll put down a blanket. I've  got black and blue marks all over my  butt, and my Mom's getting uptight  about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he fumbles for a blanket in a locker, thumping and ba gear around as he rummages for it. Tina sips wine content satisfied to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sandpiper's hull, alone above us, as the Shark rises  with dreadful certainty, attracted by the erratic sounds Ed's hasty search.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: The terrible fin breaks the surface, about 20 yards out,  then dips and disappears. Then, impossibly fast, the enti Sandpiper is lifted from underneath by a powerful surge, the Shark lunges up against it from below, an unseen horr Ed is knocked over the side, into the water.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: as he breaks the surface, shaking the hair out of his eye trying to orient himself, finding the boat. He starts to  swim for it, Tina extending an arm to help him climb aboa

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNWALE, TOWARDS ED
dialogues.text: He has barely taken two strokes when a powerful force tak him from below the surface, rushing him towards us throug the water. Tina screams. Before Ed can react to the pain, is slammed face first into the boat. His jaw breaks, bloo smears his nose and lip. His hands grab the wooden-cap rail with a death-grip.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Tina is staring down at the water, terror-stricken; Ed's  arms and head are f.g., as he locks onto the boat with  desperate hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's hands on the rail, knuckles white, an iron grip. Wit awful finality, the force pulls down, and the wood shatte and splits away as Ed's hands are pulled down and under b the awful force.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: her mouth working silently, unable to scream, staring dow at the blood and froth on the water, swirling in a grim e under her, the Sandpiper rocking gently in the diminishin swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the way to the lighthouse, but away from the harbor, t Kids are sailing in fairly close order: The sloops (Polo, Timmy, Marge) heeled well over in the stiff breeze, the f cats (Mike, Larry, Donny, etc.) skimming around, tacking  more often, faster and more maneuverable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster! Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ducks under the boom, handling the jib sheets with ea familiarity. They come about and scoot off on a new tack.

dialogues.speaker: POLO
dialogues.text: Reading the wind, trimming sail expertly, competent and a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a near-by boat) Great day! I think the wind's going  to change...

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY AND BROOKE
dialogues.text: He comes about, she slides into him, he holds her to stea her, she snuggles into his arms. True love, at last... He thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: In his inflatable, poking slowly along. Marge passes him, Sean hooting with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowpoke! Slowpoke! Marge is faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting new sails, then watch  out. Just a question of modifying  the rigging!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE'S "GREEN MACHINE"
dialogues.text: Jackie, Mike and Andy, clipping along, Larry Vaughn and B in the Sizzler nearby. Mike lifts the hull, Jackie squeal in delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheee! Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast is enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trims his sheets, the cat heels more, one hull flying, Andy and Jackie clinging to the trampoline.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIZZLER
dialogues.text: Larry is carefully adjusting his tiller, Bob senses what  he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming up on him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Hang on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gybe sharply, running up behind the green cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up! Give way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell! We're on the starboard  tack!

dialogues.speaker: THE SIZZLER AND THE "GREEN MACHINE"
dialogues.text: Running close to each other; very tight two-by-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him pass. Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Larry silently fight for clean air, racing. Wate splashes over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hair's getting wet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's mine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE'S BOAT
dialogues.text: He veers onto a less dramatic tack, sparing Jackie's hair Larry and Bob speed by, yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we get to the lighthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, dark eyes, soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tide's turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy reveals a knowledgeable side to his character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be fighting the  current. (he looks up) Wind's backing around a few points,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie snuggles against Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes forward to trim the jib, leaving the lovebirds  snuggling astern. They pull away from us, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen and Brody are in the jeep; he's driving her to work There's a crowd at dockside, and the town ambulance's now familiar blinking red light. Brody, out of force of habit wheels the jeep towards the action, nudging through the c which gives way to the official blue-and-white vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- it's not your job any more.  I'm going to be late for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out, and pushes through the crowd, Ellen followin

dialogues.speaker: DOCKSIDE
dialogues.text: The dive boat is moored at a clumsy angle next to the Pol Boat, where Hendricks has been pulling routine maintenanc The Police launch is cluttered with tools and spare parts some non-essential piece of gear is stripped and laid out the deck. Hendricks is on the dive boat, kneeling next to Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE DIVE BOAT
dialogues.text: Andrews is shaking, bloody froth on his lips and chest. T shaken divers are huddled together, an ambulance attendan is wheeling a gurney into position. Crosby and Sparky are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embolism. Air bubbles in his blood.  Came up too damn fast. Held his  goddamn breath!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is near collapse himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He panicked! Something scared him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Ambulance Attendant is putting a blanket around Sparky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. We're taking care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other attendant holds something out to Brody. Brody  examines it; a scuba mouthpiece, bitten in two, useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite reflex, like a spasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right after, the Kids went out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Kids? Who went out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them. Mike, Junior Vaughn,  Brookie Peters, Pat, Lucy -- all  that whole gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike? Our Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Looked like they were headed to  the lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an hour, maybe two. (thinking) Let's see -- I came on about eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is gone, pushing through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: Brody is casting off lines. Ellen is on the dock, watchin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Chief -- look. You're not Chief  any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody keeps working, making ready for sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you take her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is climbing aboard, taking off her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brody, look -- if he can't go,  then you can't go. Neither of you  can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I signed for the boat. You're  not authorized any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody starts the engines with a roar, and slams it into  reverse. The boat starts out of the slip, then lunges to halt, shuddering on its still-fastened bow mooring line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untie that rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she moves purposefully towards the boat cleat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brody, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is shifting gears, the boat is crabbing sideways as puts the helm hard over. It bumps the dock, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too close. Back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Hendricks, untie the rope  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks goes to the bow, jumps aboard and frees the bow line. The boat slips into reverse, the water boiling as B guns it away from the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the wheel, eases off on the rudder, and comes ab pointing the launch out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, they can't fire both  of us -- someone's got to be in  charge, right? Which way are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the Kids. The lighthouse -- you  said something about the lighthouse.  Get us there.

dialogues.speaker: THE HARBOR
dialogues.text: The Amity Police Boat, Brody, Ellen and Hendricks aboard, headed under full power out to sea. Hendricks is pumping horn, warning boats out of the way, ignoring the rules of the road; as small boats scatter out of the way, we can s the ambulance, red light flashing, pushing out slowly thr the crowd at dockside.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE AMITY POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: As they clear the harbor mouth, Brody is on the radio, El is crouching in the shelter of the deckhouse, Hendricks i steering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amity Launch to Harbor Patrol, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Harbor Patrol. Is that you, Brody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative. Can you get your chopper  airborne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10-4, in a few minutes. He's down  checking a buoy in the Bay Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him the hell over to Amity Point,  the old lighthouse. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bunch of Kids day-sailing  that way. Turn them back to port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Just do it, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10-4, soon as I can raise him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're not at the light, look  for them. I don't want them out there.  Get them back to port!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Affirmative, affirmative. Turn the  Kids day-sailing back to port. I  heard you. Patrol out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brody's eyes sweep the horizon anxiously, Hendricks po it on, and the police boat surges forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie and Denise and Susie are sailing close to each oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starving. Let's go eat now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to Susie) We're going in to eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods agreement, their boats veer off from the rest an head towards the lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIZZLER
dialogues.text: as it sails close to the Green Machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Brody! Want to race?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confident) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a side bet to make it  interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fun! Let's race for something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loser sails home alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Mike) You're betting what you already got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do -- you win either way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) I'm supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bet. Once around the marker  buoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the pin -- the buoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is confident -- he's got the air, but Mike suddenly gybes without warning, snapping onto a new fast tack,  downwind. Larry and Bob are caught by surprise, and lose  precious moments as they fumble with their sails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away) Turkeys! Eat wind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yee-hah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds with glee on the canvas trampoline as their boa moves ahead, a drumming sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twin hulls of a catamaran's hull, the muffled, eerie  sound of drumming, as the water carries the tempting "thu thud-thud" sound down to the deep.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG IN HIS INFLATABLE
dialogues.text: falling behind as the boats change course for the marker  buoy, following Larry and Mike's lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait for the H.M.S. Invincible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke and Timmy sail by him, laughing; Polo with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't -- we're watching a race!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when? Who's racing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Mike!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK AND LUCY
dialogues.text: Pat and Lucy are trimming sail, moving faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Larry are racing! Loser  goes home alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we beat them, they can both go  home stag! Single-O! Alone! Jackie  can come back in this boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh. Well. Maybe you could give Polo  a hand going in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping him with a  rope) Your ass I will. Besides, the wind's  turning with the tide. Sailing back  is going to be a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SAILBOAT RACING MONTAGE
dialogues.text: --  Ropes and sails rattling through blocks. --  Sails snapping taut, filling with wind. --  Catamarans heeled over, racers hanging over the water dangerously suspended in trapeze harnesses. --  Skippers' faces, concentrating on boat handling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the chopper's point of view, as the Harbor Patrol co from the Cape flies towards the Kids, following Brody's  previous instructions. He sees the sailboats and fly that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered, into his  mike) Air Patrol to Base. I have visual  contact on the Kids. Going down to  use the loud hailer...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP AT THE APPROACHING COPTER
dialogues.text: It approaches the sailboats, losing altitude fast, rotor  blades chuffing up a storm. The Pilot has his microphone to his lips, and his voice i blaring down at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Harbor Patrol. Return to  port immediately. Return -- to --  port -- immediately.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOATS
dialogues.text: The Kids look at each other, some coming about awkwardly, others luffing, wondering what this is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike) Your dad must be really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better go back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fighting wind and current. I  though we'd be out longer, catch the  incoming tide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Putz -- that won't be for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was counting on hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return -- to -- port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying, we're trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves acknowledgement, and puts about. The others take their cue from him, and set a rough course back, but with much success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE SLOOPS
dialogues.text: Polo, Timmy and Brooke, Marge and Sean. They see the fast catamarans come about and try to beat back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're turning around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming about, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to try. Lighthouse, everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts about, the three of them start back towards the  lighthouse, not making much headway. Doug's inflatable is the slowest, and he is now, by virtue of his position, at the head of the line beating back towards the island.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG'S BOAT
dialogues.text: The others in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way for the Carrier Enterprise!

dialogues.speaker: A WEAK PATCH IN THE RUBBER
dialogues.text: It whistles and visibly leaks under the strain.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: looking down in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that the Titanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rigs a little foot pump, and begins thumping away, try to breath air back into the raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrol One to Base. Looks like they're  turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Patrol. Go back to work.  You've wasted enough time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up at the scattered hulls of the sailboats, the  turbulence from the low-flying chopper making a vast circ pattern of irregular vibrations.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP AT THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: It wheels around, and heads back towards land.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE AMITY POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: Rushing through the seas under full power. About three hu yards ahead, a small, seemingly empty sailboat; Ed and Ti Sandpiper. Further off, a day-sailing power cruiser, spor fishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not his boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks maneuvers closer, slowing the engine, reversing time to bring them alongside with a gentle bump. Ellen wa apprehensively as Brody drops into the little boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the Sandpiper) Nope... (he sees something) Hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody moves around on the deck of the Sandpiper, until he discovers Tina, cowering in shock; a sudden revealing of terrorized victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moan) N-o-o-o-o-o-o...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay. What's the  matter? Tina? Honey? Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's still there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hendricks and  Ellen) I need a hand here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks has gotten a blanket, and he steps over, puttin it over the shivering girl's shoulders. Ellen comforts th girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina, baby... what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh... Sh... Shark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. I goddamn well told them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves abruptly, stepping up onto the police launch,  snapping on the radio, leaving Hendricks, Ellen and Tina the sailboat moored alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amity Launch to Harbor Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filter) This is Cape Patrol -- what is it,  Brody? I heard you weren't chief  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip that. What about those kids out  sailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all okay -- Colby got to them.  They were turning back when he left  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He's got work to do in Bay  Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him the hell back there! We got  possible fatalities! Brody out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes wild, Brody looks over at the Sandpiper, then sc the nearby waters with sudden tension.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Ellen and Hendricks comforting Tina on the Sandpiper. Nea a big cabin cruiser casually trolling by. Brody pulls the police boat's air horn, the cruiser's passengers look ove Hendricks and Ellen jump at the unexpected blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- you can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody starts the launch's motor, throwing clear the moori line that ties the two boats together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hendricks) Get her in. Get them both in. ELLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 10 degrees off your starboard  bow, take a heading leeward of Sand  Island, and lay her north by  northeast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that shit. Just point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hendricks complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) See where Cable Junction is? Look to  the left. The lighthouse. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he kicks the engine into gear, moving the launch away and out toward the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back! Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guns the engine as soon as he's clear. Hendricks gives his jacket to a suddenly chilled Ellen, and hails the cab cruiser, already changing course to pick them up, soundin its horn. Ellen stares after the receding boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My purse is on that boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are trying to beat back towards the lighthouse, figh wind and tide. Only Doug's inflatable, with its clumsy li motor, is making any headway.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: playing at being Charles Laughton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Christian! Mr. Christian! Pump  up this boat! And shave that silly  moustache!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pumping, steering, he's floundering along.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING TOWARDS THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The Shark has fixated on something -- one outlying shape, the easily identifiable outline of Doug's inflatable, thu and putting. It homes in on the sound.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG AND THE KIDS
dialogues.text: The other kids exchange banter with Doug in his raft, as clowns for their benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England expects every man to do his  duty... You may fire when ready,  Gridley... Damn the torpedoes, full  speed ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite his pumping, the bulging patch bursts with a loud bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone pop your balloon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a lifesaver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a skyhook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sail your boat, I'll sail mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fin rises partially, almost invisible to most of the ki but Mike notices it, believing it to be a porpoise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Fetterman -- You got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company? The place is a mess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before anyone can react, the shape rises behind Doug, str his raft a terrible blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHERS, WATCHING
dialogues.text: Not making any headway themselves, they casually watch th class clown, wondering what he's up to this time.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG'S BOAT
dialogues.text: a distance from the rest. It shakes, then blows up as big teeth grip it from below. Doug goes flying into the drink The Shark has the inflatable in his teeth, and is shaking from side to side. Doug's eyes bug out as he sees what's  going on. He begins treading water, backing away as fast he can, waving his arm in the air frantically -- "pick me up, quick..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sails to where Doug is being carried along by the curr The inflatable is a mess -- shredded rubber and dead engi the Shark didn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug! This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug carefully -- oh, so carefully -- strokes over to whe Mike and Andy can pull him abroad. Some of the others sai closer to get a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for the rubber duck.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP, DRIFTING TOGETHER
dialogues.text: This incident hasn't yet touched them -- no one actually what it was, except Doug, who's never been serious about  anything. Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shark ate my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, a goddamn shark ate  my goddamn boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he liked your boat, I got some  sneakers he'll love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nervous laughter from all around as they examine remains of Doug's inflatable. Some of those jagged rents  could be made by teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib) ...Jeez -- what did that?... A  porpoise, maybe...Nah, killer whale...  I think he snagged it... I hate to  pop his balloon... (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Doug's inflatable is draped over the tip of one hull, for Without warning, the Shark hits. Screams, terror, confusi Mike, Andy, Jackie into the water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: His head bangs on a metal fitting as the boat turns over.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Patrick and Lucy ram into Timmy's boat, locking into it,  knocking Timmy into the water as Brooke screams.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSION
dialogues.text: As the following events take place: --  Larry's red cat rams and locks onto Mike's Tornado. --  Marge's boat capsizes, putting Sean and Marge into th drink. --  Marge scrambles up on the over-turned hull, pulling S up with her, just in time. --  Polo, under full sail, scoops Mike out of the water b the Shark can get to him. --  The Shark dips out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: THE STERN OF POLO'S BOAT
dialogues.text: showing the results of the turmoil:

dialogues.speaker: THE SURVIVORS
dialogues.text: As they make ineffectual, frightened moves towards groupi together, Andy is the first to gain any composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raft up! Raft 'em up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches towards a drifting line, and pulls Timmy's  Doughdish towards them, tying it off as it comes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie off to your strongest point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone need an extra line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polo has Mike and Timmy aboard his boat.  Timmy is lookin up from examining Mike's dazed body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's bleeding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you sail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testing his rudder) Yeah! We'll take him in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to make sail back towards the lighthouse, on a  severe, but manageable tack. Polo, Timmy, and the injured Mike sail towards safety, leaving the others behind. Tackle the job at hand, concentrating on survival. Jackie strangely quiet; things are out of control...

dialogues.speaker: A NAUTICAL CHART
dialogues.text: clearly marked: Amity Island, Amity Lighthouse, Cable  Junction. Brody's nervous finger traces an approximation his course. It fumbles, pauses, stops.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: Brody, looking up from his chart, scans the ocean. Ahead the Lighthouse, his immediate destination. Out of sight t the right, Cable Junction, and beyond that, 2500 miles of cold Atlantic. Brody looks up from his chart, and grabs t radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Amity Launch to Patrol Air Unit One.  Harbor Air, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filter) This is Air One. That you, Brody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Any fix on those Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. I'm still down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, get going! I'm  all alone out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody, I got to switch frequencies,  call my boss. We'll meet you over by  Francis Shoal. Harbor Air out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Francis Shoal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static. No answer. Brody realizes something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all alone out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Amity Police Boat, under full  power, surging through the heavy  swell, Brody very much alone at the  helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see Brody's boat approaching. It slows as it nears the island.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: staring, perplexed. Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the wheel over, slewing the boat around. To the l the wrong way. ANGLE ON THE BOAT, LIGHTHOUSE IN B.G. It barrels off to the left.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFTED BOATS
dialogues.text: floating in the current, drifting away from the lighthous towards the open sea. Floating on the wreckage and tangle boats are:  Doug, Andy, Jackie, Patrick, Lucy, Larry, Bob Brooke, Marge, and Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, Bob, Patrick, and Lucy (the practiced sailors) ad equal dissatisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tide doesn't turn for three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low tide at Cable Junction is 7:46  p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do? Memorize the tide  tables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it, it sticks in my  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making light of it) Anyone want to play charades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we're drifting, might as  well go with the flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three knot current?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least. And an offshore wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's after Cable Junction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atlantic. Then Ireland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're probably looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
