dialogues.text: What about the fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tend to follow moving things.  Maybe it's following Polo and Timmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They consider this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all we have to do is land at Cable  Junction and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we got to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we going to do that floating  on this garbage...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone got another set of sails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids scramble to rig whatever canvas is available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that big thing still out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER, (AERIAL)
dialogues.text: A panorama of open ocean; a quick fly-by to orient us: Fi Cable Junction, then, a mile or so ahead, the raft.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: More sail, some improvised rigging, Patrick and Lucy trim what there is, trying to steer the clumsy contraption. Fr afar, the distant sound of an approaching chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving) Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids react with enthusiasm to the arrival of the resc chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't everyone jump around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they ignore him. The copter is descending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one-man light spotter; the space next to the pilot clut with tools and floats, lashed in place. Below, seen throu the plastic bubble, the raft growing larger as the choppe sets down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air One to Base. I have a positive  location on that sailing party.  Disabled and adrift... (he checks chart on  his knee board) ...about 3/4 miles west of Cable  Junction, wind and current carrying  them just about due east. I count  ten juveniles.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: The helicopter is creating a lot of turbulence as it sets down, a huge circular pattern of prop-wash on the surface the rotors slow to a halt. The Kids are waving and jubila

dialogues.speaker: THE COPTER
dialogues.text: As the Pilot unbuckles, opens the door, and steps out on pontoon; he speaks through a bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone okay? Any injuries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids ad-lib in the affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put us on Cable Junction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no room for passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a tow? Can you rig that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot nods. Larry heaves a line to him, the Pilot cat it and makes it fast to a convenient tie-off on the  undercarriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as you get us on the island,  you got to call in. My dad's the  mayor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) There's a shark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Kids all chime in, adding their ad-lib shouts  describing what happened, calling for help, etc. It's all noisy jumble, the Pilot ignores it, trying to do his job.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: The Kids all shouting at once; Jackie is screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to take us off! You have  to! Why don't you take us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming her) It's an observation spotter, he  doesn't have the room...

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He finishes tying off, and yells through his bullhorn at Kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I'm going to give you an  assist to get you on Cable Junction.  Then I'll call in, and get the Coast  Guard to send a cutter. Hang on to  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs into his bubble, shuts the door, gives the Kids "thumbs up," and starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: RAFT AND CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Engine turning over. A line tied off to one of the ringbolts on an overturned  hull; it pulls taut out of the water. INT. CHOPPER, THE PILOT INTENT ON HIS JOB. The raft, Kids watching in fascination and anticipation. The whole operation, getting under way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking up at pontoons, wreckage, wind turbulence on the  surface, the heavy "thud-thud-thud" of chopper blades.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT AND CHOPPER
dialogues.text: In the f.g., the fin rises, and starts for the scene. Follow it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: as it starts to lift, inexplicably. The Pilot reacts as;

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: attacks one of the pontoons, biting down on it, clamping  great scarred jaws onto the bulbous floats.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: Kids screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --  Rotor blade spinning wildly. --  Pilot's hands jerked on the delicate controls. --  Med. shot, copter shaking. --  Closeup engine and gas tanks, rotor head spinning. --  Med. closeup Pilot in buffeting cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: RAFT AND COPTER
dialogues.text: The Kids watch, horror-stricken, as the giant Shark hangs the roaring copter; in the b.g., Cable Junction is loomin closer. The copter tilts dangerously, the Shark bites dee harder.

dialogues.speaker: THE COPTER
dialogues.text: as it tilts. Then, the unspeakable -- the blades touch th water and explode. Chunks of murderous steel break off th shattered blades and whistle through the air like project

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS
dialogues.text: reacting, ducking in terror. Huge chunks of disintegratin rotors are flying all around. Masts and sails left standi before are chopped into a deadly salad. Screams.

dialogues.speaker: LOW IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: as blades skip and crash, the bubble of the overturned co Pilot trapped inside, sinks into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: THE COPTER COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Pilot struggling with his safety harness, trying to hit  switches, working on instinct. Some air in the bubble, bu water too, and sparks as electrical connections short out and burn. Then, the Shark, powering out of the murk.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: as grim death batters at his fragile bubble. Screaming. The bubble cracks. Water floods, teeth snap at the slippe plastic, the Pilot fumbles for oxygen as the Shark veers into the murk.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The Kids, reacting as the broken copter sinks beneath the waves. Calm for a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) No-o-o-o!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shark reappears, and batters at the raft.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK ATTACK
dialogues.text: The raft shudders, and begins to break up under the pound The Kids cling for their lives to masts and wreckage. Marge's overturned hull is struck a fierce blow from bene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Marge topple into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't struggle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean is bobbing in his life-vest, Marge strokes to be nea him.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE AND SEAN
dialogues.text: in the water, swimming for the apparent safety of the raf Then, the fin, and the massive bulk of the killer, heavin up through the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heaves him up out of the water, hurling him with  desperation towards the safety of the floating hull.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: screaming, hands and feet scrabbling like a monkey as he  struggles for a grip on the slippery surface. Behind him, Marge helping as much as she can from the water. Then, be her;

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: rising like grey doom, then dropping out of sight. Marge gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge ducking under the bulk of the Shark, shoving off wi panicky reserves of strength, swimming away underwater, w the Shark takes a massive crunching bite out of a submerg hull. Follow Marge as she swims.

dialogues.speaker: COPTER WRECKAGE
dialogues.text: Huddled in the cracked plastic bubble, the Pilot is sucki air from his oxygen tank. He sees Marge, and slips out of his bubble, headed for her.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: As the Pilot overtakes her -- a moment of horror, as she  thinks the Shark has found her, then relief, as the Pilot motions to the bubble, and indicates "Air." She follows h

dialogues.speaker: MARGE AND THE PILOT
dialogues.text: Scuttling like two crabs into the shelter of the broken  chopper, buddy breathing as he passes her the oxygen tube The chopper tilts, and moves, breaking up on the bottom a currents move it. They struggle silently.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: as it slips across the bottom, the current pulling it, br parts breaking off in slow motion, dirty swirls of oil an hydraulic fluid clouding the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: A parallel struggle for survival, as the current separate Sean from the other Kids; Marge is gone, the little boy i clinging alone to the free-floating Lightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Sean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy! Please help! Help!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Copter wreckage is bubbling up from underneath, like a  submarine destroyed by depth charges; an oil slick, piece of broken blade, a seat cushion, then, suddenly, the Pilo and Marge, almost choked to death, their air run out. The cling to a section of pontoon, panting, looking around wi oxygen-starved eyes. They are alone on the ocean; a half-mile away, the distan sails of the broken raft, and the low-lying shape of Cabl Junction. Safe, for now...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: He throttles down, and the boat slumps in the water. He l around, sees nothing, in all directions. He hits his radi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harbor Air, this is Brody. Air One,  come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static, no answer. He tries a couple of times, checking t knobs and dials to make sure the unit's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harbor Air, do you read? Over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody? This is Patrol Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar voice is tinged with annoyance. He's had a l shift, and nothing's going right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Air One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'd like to know. Lost  transmission at Cable Junction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he raise the Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last transmission said ten juveniles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then nothing. If you see him, tell  him to switch to an operational  frequency, or give me a status report  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say Cable Junction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1530 hours. Might still be there.  Base out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody revs up, and powers out, headed for Cable Junction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean is crying on his isolated perch, clinging to the upt keel. The other Kids are throwing a rope, trying to get h back. Patrick heaves, and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Catch the rope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope! The rope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others shoot fearful glances at the waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got to help or it won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, baby, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean is ignoring the efforts to rescue him, paralyzed by  fear, he shivers alone. Jackie is near catatonia herself, Brooke and Doug trying to soothe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It killed her. It ate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Listen! Listen to me, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid looks up dully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Sean, you listen to me  or I will kick your ass, do you hear  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to Andy, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're throwing a rope and you better  catch it, hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean nods. The other Kids are encouraged. The rope is thr it misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) Keep an eye out for that fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob climbs to a vantage point, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Catch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another miss. In his haste to help, Larry overreaches to  fish the trailing rope out of the water, and falls headlo into the sea. Shrieks of fright from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles out, hardly wet, that's how fast he's moving Finally -- Patrick takes the crucial throw, and the rope  practically knocks Sean off his perch, but he clutches an holds it. As Andy carefully calls instructions, Sean secu the rope and the others carefully, carefully begin to pul him in.

dialogues.speaker: ON SEAN
dialogues.text: as they pull. The slippery rope is undoing itself.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: With the kids reaching out hands, sticks, rope, anything pull the little one to safety. The ocean swells rise and  fall with hidden menace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --  Hands gripping rope. --  The knot, pulling apart. --  Anguished faces, concentrating, as Patrick, Lucy, Lar and Andy struggle to bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY AND SEAN
dialogues.text: Success. He's pulled to safety. They lash his little hull tight as they can to the rest of the floating wreckage. Bob sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cable Junction's ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BOB'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: looking over the wreckage to Cable Junction, now much clo Beyond it, miles of empty Atlantic. It's off to one side, and unless they can slow down or alter course, they will  miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jackie) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not. Shaking, silent, eyes glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alone) Dear Jesus, Holy Mary, Mother of  God, help us, please... (her lips move  inaudibly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doug) Keep her warm.  (to Jackie) Jackie? Baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone help me rig a jury rudder?   We might steer this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy joins him, and they try to make a sweep or a rudder of whatever wreckage they can use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By 7:46, when the tide turns around,  we'll be twenty miles out. More,  with this wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop thinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (praying aloud) God, please help us, Merciful Father,  in Christ's name, we beg you, help  us, please, Dear God, save us, help  us, please, God, help...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: He is rounding a sand bar off the lighthouse when he look ahead and sees the bright sails of some of the survivors' boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the helm over and heads for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polo's sloop is beating back towards the harbor when the  police launch bears down, Brody leaning on the air horn. The Kids signal and wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming alongside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The launch slows clumsily. Timmy gets a line around a cle and pulls them fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shark hit us out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike got knocked over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody goes for his radio, to report in, to call for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I passed out, but I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you're safe. What about the  others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three boys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, don't freeze on me. What about  the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears in his eyes) Sean's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops in his tracks, radio forgotten. heartsick. Mike  goes on,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to come. It was okay, wasn't  it? It was okay before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others are ratted together.  Drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the current. Towards Cable  Junction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody jerks the mooring line holding them together, freei it. He starts for his controls, obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. Don't go anywhere. Just  stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the lighthouse, then guns his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay at the lighthouse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He roars off, headed towards Cable Junction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: approaching Cable Junction the rafted boats are drifting  towards the Cable Junction.  Larry, Patrick and Andy are  working on improvised tiller lines to a jury rudder made of wreckage. Lucy has another line out to a sea anchor, t to slow their drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her to port a little. That's  it -- steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're changing course a  little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we land on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comforting her) It's all right, we're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More to port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all the way over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to go on the island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the realist) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, we're steering for  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind drift is lateral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sideways -- For every yard we go  this way, we also slide sideways  this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands illustrate the predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we had it! We were headed right  for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Shit, shit, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to miss it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others are silent. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: Larry, Bob and Brooke try to alter its course by padding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop paddling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the island!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They freeze, as the raft grinds against something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inverted mast of one of the wrecked boats is snagged the rocks on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: as it slows, then stops, hung up from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hung up on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysteria) It's that thing. It's going to kill  us now... We're going to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Just shut Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, man... LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad enough without  her freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group dissolves in bitter exchanges. No one is ration Lucy is the first to notice something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Listen! Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group subsides, only Jackie is left, keening to herse There's a distant sound of a boat's engine. Bob spots it  first, and waves. The others follow his pointing finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there! Coming this way!

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: under full power, heading straight for them,

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS
dialogues.text: go crazy, waving, yelling, screaming, "Over here!" "Help! "Hey!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dad!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AND THE RAFT
dialogues.text: in the boat, coming up on the Kids fast. He throttles bac his bow wave almost swamping them as he slides past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, easy -- you'll swamp us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody fumbles with the throttle, manages to hold his boat steady between the raft and Cable Junction island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hung up here. Snagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get us a line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody finds a coil of line, makes one end fast, then thro it to the Kids on the raft. They catch it, and tie it off a cleat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody throttles forward, the police boat shudders under t strain as the line goes taut.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: where the rope is tied off to a cleat. The wood groans, s pop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. The cleat rips out, Brody's boat leaps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come around again!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S BOAT
dialogues.text: as he repositions; he's now between the raft and the isla preparing to throw his line. He heaves, the Kids grab, th have it, they tie off again,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on -- we got it. You're  on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody starts to pull the raft again, when:

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: surfaces, and moves purposefully towards the gap that  separates the police boat from the raft. It lunges at Bro as it passes the launch; the fin hits the taut rescue lin snapping it.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Brody recoils in horror as the beast rushes past, he spin the wheel and hits the throttle, sending the launch hard port. Out of control, it runs up on the rocks of Cable  Junction.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOAT
dialogues.text: as it tips up on the rocks. Brody falls, equipment and lo material breaks loose and falls.

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO
dialogues.text: held by only a few screws, it pulls out of its mount and  shatters on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: THE STERN
dialogues.text: lifting high out of the water, the screw turning in air.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS ON THE RAFT
dialogues.text: Their horrified reactions.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE BOAT
dialogues.text: picks himself up, and staggers to the rail, sees his  predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, baby, I'm here. It's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs over the rail, onto the slippery wet rocks, try to get to where he can help. The Shark patrols the gap,  waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get a line to me?

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE RAFT
dialogues.text: the Kids find some line. Andy coils, and throws.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE JUNCTION
dialogues.text: Brady catches the Kids' line. He heaves on it with all hi might. Nothing. Jackie is hysterical, some of the other K are screaming. The Shark's fin catches the taut line, it  slides up and over, Brody and the Kids are nearly pulled  into the water. The raft doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the mast bends under the strain, but holds the raft stuck fast.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE JUNCTION
dialogues.text: He sees the winch and hooks on his launch, and makes the  towline fast to the steel winch cable; puts it in neutral The Kids haul their line, trying to bring the steel cable them. The shark rams their raft, impatient now. Screams and  scrambling as they let go their line and try to avoid the beast. Brooke huddles with Sean, Jackie cowers alone. Lar is lashing his big buck knife to a pole, an improvised we

dialogues.speaker: THE WINCH LINE
dialogues.text: Unattended, it drops into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the cable in! Pull!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do, but now the winch cable is snagged under the sur It comes taut, but doesn't budge. Brody watches, helpless for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch is stuck!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: climbs back onto the boat, starts the winch engine, tryin to pull the cable free.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: on the offensive now, takes an outrigger pontoon, biting tearing it off the raft, shaking everything.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RAFT
dialogues.text: the Kids react to this fresh attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killing us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die! Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOAT
dialogues.text: The winch smokes and stalls, the weight it's pulling almo too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you bastard, come on, pull.   Pull!

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: bursts apart from the center as the Shark lunges up throu the canvas trampoline of the Sizzler. The Kids, screaming fall into the water as the attack forces the fragile stru into pieces. Only Sean, Brooke, and Jackie are left on th remaining segment.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: watching the destruction, seeing Sean practically alone i the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the deck frantically, spots a rubber emer inflatable in its case. He wrestles it off its brackets, breaks the seals urgently. He hits the auto-inflate.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Alone on the raft, Brooke and Jackie helpless nearby, the other Kids flailing in the water. The huge bulk of the Sh fin cutting the water as it closes in on the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: While Brody inflates the rubber raft and throws it in the water, the Kids scramble for safety, swimming for their l Each one is sure this moment is going to be his last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the rocks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swim for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is pulling himself towards the boat, scrambling up o the exposed wooden hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy! Look out!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY AND BOB
dialogues.text: As she looks over her shoulder and screams -- the monster sliding past her, intent on Bob. The rough hide scrapes h tearing her clothes, leaving raw bleeding lacerations on torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bleeding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Patrick help her towards the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's clinging to a piece of broken boat; the Shark lunges him.

dialogues.speaker: WINCH
dialogues.text: grinding, smoking, hauling something out of the water --  heavy, slimy, dripping metal cable, the main powerline fr the mainland!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: paddling the raft towards Sean with desperate strokes,  heedless of the danger around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on! Just hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fights to see in the gathering gloom. Suddenly, a stra glare snaps on, then more illumination, in a series of  escalating clicks.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE JUNCTION
dialogues.text: Silhouetted against the evening sky. Automatic timers are turning on navigation and worklights, illuminating the ba rocks and rusty steel with their glare -- throwing dark  shadows, putting the surrounding water into black limbo b their contract.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: straining to see what's going on. Looking for his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Help! Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around desperately, sees Andy safe on the launch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy! Use the lights! The lights!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: soaked, clinging to the rail of the launch, hearing Brody fumbling in the cabin, turning on worklights, the boat  throwing erratic shafts of powerful light from its many l and searchlights. Andy grabs one and sweeps the water wit it, trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His light pokes and sweeps through the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: He hears the horrendous sounds of wood and metal breaking as the raft pounds to pieces on the rocks. He is blinded the sweeping searchlight, the confusion of terror-stricke teen-agers screaming. It's the middle of The Inferno.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Sean, standing up, reaching out to him, the Shark hitting his fragile perch, Sean tumbling backwards, towards what  seems to be certain death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: as he hurls his paddle at the Shark, anything to get even to distract it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around him wildly, searching for a weapon, findi a steel boathook. He screams at the unfeeling Shark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, you son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge gray hulk obligingly turns towards this new  irritation. Brody bangs on the raft, yelling, creating a  commotion.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: lunges at the raft, Brody sliding desperately away, smash at the snout with his steel, the tail fin bashing him as passes...

dialogues.speaker: THE STERN OF THE POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: Brody is drifting close to the cable, drawn heavy and wet cut of the water. He reaches up to it.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: dangling his feet in the water, holding onto the cable, s it, inspired with a lunatic idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! You bastard! Over here

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: turns, bleeding from a superficial cut on its snout, its  scar glistening wet and terrible. It heads for Brody.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Possessed, yelling at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get me! Come and get me!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Attacking. Missing Brody, who hauls himself up out of the way in life-or-death spasm. The great jaws close, fasteni onto the thick cable. Shaking it. The cable resists for a moment, then splits, layers or insulation and armor crack open, the jaws clamp harder -- 20,000 tons of pressure -- then the live copper core is reached. Zap!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: dying. Leaping and convulsing as hundreds of thousands of volts surge through its body, grounded in the salt sea. H white fire shimmers like a halo, the fish smokes and stin sputters, and dies.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: watching, cowering on the rubber raft to which he fell wh the shark hit the cable. It's strangely silent. The light on Cable Junction flicker and die as circuit breakers shu down the mains, protecting the line. Only the boat's  worklights provide light now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Water lapping at the rocks, some Kids sobbing  quietly. Brody listlessly paddles towards the wreckage of the raft, expecting the worst...

dialogues.speaker: THE WRECKAGE
dialogues.text: Timmy's Doughdish, where we last saw Sean. There's a  scrabbling from inside, and Sean appears, soaked, from un the seat where he'd fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody moves toward him, holds out his arms, taking Sean o his raft. They paddle back towards the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: THE ISLAND
dialogues.text: with the Kids clinging like drowned rats to the rocks; th wet, scared, exhausted, but safe. Sean hugs his daddy as  they step onto land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They made me go with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure they did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses the damp forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of worried parents and adults, Ellen and Hendrick in the forefront, are staring towards the harbor mouth. I dawn and the sun is rising. They see something, a cheer g up.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: A big Coast Guard cutter is steaming into the harbor, a l group of survivors on the foredeck.

dialogues.speaker: THE CUTTER
dialogues.text: Brody and the surviving Kids wave to their families on la
